Class Player

Creature
ca.sfu.cmpt276.fall2025.team14.model.Player
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
public class Player extends Creature
Represents the player character controlled by the user. The player is a
invalid reference 
Creature
that supports movement, animation control, visibility/invulnerability states, and game-loop updates. This class follows a singleton design to ensure only one player exists.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Modifier
    Constructor
    Description
    protected
    Player()
    Constructs a new Player with the default "player" spritesheet.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    protected IEntityAnimationController<?>
    createAnimationController()
    Creates the player's animation controller responsible for managing sprite animations.
    protected IMovementController
    createMovementController()
    Creates the movement controller for the player, enabling keyboard-based movement.
    static Player
    getInstance()
    Returns the singleton instance of the player, creating it if it does not yet exist.
    IMovementController
    getMovementController()
    Gets the movement controller currently assigned to the player.
    static float
    getPlayerDefaultVelocity()
    Returns the constant default player velocity.
    boolean
    hasAlienCharm()
    Checks if the player is currently holding an Alien Charm.
    static Player
    instance()
    Returns the existing player instance without creating a new one.

    Checks if the player is currently invisible.
    boolean
    isInvulnerable()
    Checks if the player is currently invulnerable.

    resetPowerUps()
    Resets all active power-up effects on the player.
    void
    setHasAlienCharm(boolean hasAlienCharm)
    Sets whether the player currently has an Alien Charm.

    Sets whether the player is invisible.
    void
    setInvulnerable(boolean invulnerable)
    Sets whether the player is invulnerable.
    void
    stopMovement()
    Temporarily stops the player's movement by setting velocity to zero, then restoring the default velocity after a timed delay.
    void
    update()
    Called every game tick by the engine.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      protected Player()
      Constructs a new Player with the default "player" spritesheet. Protected to enforce singleton usage via getInstance().

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      Called every game tick by the engine. The Player currently has no internal update logic, but implements
      invalid reference 
      IUpdateable
      for consistency.

    • getInstance

      public static Player getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of the player, creating it if it does not yet exist.
      Returns:
      the global Player instance

    • createAnimationController

      protected IEntityAnimationController<?> createAnimationController()
      Creates the player's animation controller responsible for managing sprite animations.
      Returns:
      a new PlayerAnimationController

    • createMovementController

      protected IMovementController createMovementController()
      Creates the movement controller for the player, enabling keyboard-based movement.
      Returns:
      a
      invalid reference 
      KeyboardEntityController
      that handles directional input

    • stopMovement

      public void stopMovement()
      Temporarily stops the player's movement by setting velocity to zero, then restoring the default velocity after a timed delay.

    • getMovementController

      public IMovementController getMovementController()
      Gets the movement controller currently assigned to the player.
      Returns:
      the player's
      invalid reference 
      IMovementController

    • isInvisible

      public boolean isInvisible()
      Checks if the player is currently invisible.
      Returns:
      true if the Invisibility power-up is active, false otherwise.

    • hasAlienCharm

      public boolean hasAlienCharm()
      Checks if the player is currently holding an Alien Charm.
      Returns:
      true if the player has an Alien Charm, false otherwise.

    • isInvulnerable

      public boolean isInvulnerable()
      Checks if the player is currently invulnerable.
      Returns:
      true if the player is invulnerable, false otherwise.

    • resetPowerUps

      public void resetPowerUps()
      Resets all active power-up effects on the player. This is called by GameLogic when the level is restarted.

    • instance

      public static Player instance()
      Returns the existing player instance without creating a new one.
      Returns:
      the current Player instance, or null if uninitialized

    • getPlayerDefaultVelocity

      public static float getPlayerDefaultVelocity()
      Returns the constant default player velocity.
      Returns:
      the default movement speed

    • setInvisible

      public void setInvisible(boolean invisible)
      Sets whether the player is invisible.
      Parameters:
      invisible - true to make the player invisible

    • setHasAlienCharm

      public void setHasAlienCharm(boolean hasAlienCharm)
      Sets whether the player currently has an Alien Charm.
      Parameters:
      hasAlienCharm - true if the player has the charm

    • setInvulnerable

      public void setInvulnerable(boolean invulnerable)
      Sets whether the player is invulnerable.
      Parameters:
      invulnerable - true to make the player invulnerable
